content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function to clean a column name in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = strip(lowercase(col))
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

To explain:

- `lowercase(col)` converts the column name to all lower case
- `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespace  
- `replace(col, " " => "_")` replaces any spaces with underscores
- `replace(col, "-" => "_")` replaces any hyphens with underscores

So this standardizes the column name to a lowercase, underscore separated format with no extra whitespace.

Some examples:

```julia
clean_column("My Column") # Returns "my_column" 

clean_column("my-column") # Returns "my_column"

clean_column(" column ") # Returns "column"
```

Let me know if you have any other questions!
